    About K-AgTech LaunchPad

    
      The K-AgTech LaunchPad is a flagship agri-innovation initiative supported under
      NABARD’s Rural Business Incubation Centre (RBIC) programme. It represents the
      largest NABARD-funded project hosted at Kerala Agricultural University (KAU),
      bringing together academia, global research expertise, and industry engagement
      to strengthen India’s agri-innovation ecosystem.
    

    
      Established through a strategic collaboration between Kerala Agricultural
      University (KAU), Western Sydney University (WSU), and industry partners, the
      LaunchPad is designed to address pressing agricultural challenges through
      technology-driven solutions, applied research, and enterprise development.
    

    
      More than an incubation centre, the K-AgTech LaunchPad functions as a catalyst
      for change—supporting farmers, agripreneurs, and rural communities by enabling
      the adoption of advanced AgTech solutions and translating research outcomes
      into real-world impact.
    

    
      End-to-end incubation support for start-ups, from ideation to market readiness
      Value addition and product diversification to enhance farmers’ income
      Entrepreneurial capacity building that connects research with industry needs
      AI-enabled smart climate adaptation technologies for resilient agriculture
      Promotion of women-led enterprises to foster inclusive and sustainable growth
    

    Expected Impact

    
      The LaunchPad aims to stimulate economic growth by nurturing start-ups and
      Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs), strengthening climate resilience through
      smart agricultural practices, and enabling global knowledge exchange through
      WSU-led collaborations.
    

    
      By establishing a supportive entrepreneurial ecosystem and a state-of-the-art
      incubation facility, the programme seeks to accelerate AI-integrated precision
      agriculture, promote scalable agripreneurship, and contribute meaningfully to
      the transformation of Kerala’s agricultural landscape.
